channel.title: No-ip DUC problem "error connecting to server" please help
channel.description:
Alright so my server has been running fine for 2 months on my VPS (from vpsland) and 2 days ago, i was making a quick update so i restarted the server, everyone disconnected and couldnt get back on. i check the server on the vps and it was fine, it was running. i had this problem once before but i was able to fix it by redownloading DUC. This time however, i redownloaded, made a new account on no-ip, reset my no-ip... everything possible (i think) here is what the no-ip DUC keeps saying over and over.... [img]http://i53.tinypic.com/287mb6d.jpg[/img]
My server has now been down 36 hours, because of this no-ip problem.... If anyone can help i will greatly appreciate it and i will even reward you somehow on my server, or a paypal gift (:

You could read my post add my msn as stated above I’ll fix

item.description:
@fashofasho wrote:

When i am done with the vps, i “x” out at the top, it still leaves my server running. and i have never logged in the vps on 2 remote desktops at the same time… Ive also checked the ips on the no-ip with the vps, they are the same… this is really weird…

item.title: No-ip DUC problem "error connecting to server" please help
item.dc:creator: @Dell Dell
item.description:
@Dell wrote:

[quote=“fashofasho, post:1, topic:380659”]Alright so my server has been running fine for 2 months on my VPS (from vpsland) and 2 days ago, i was making a quick update so i restarted the server, everyone disconnected and couldnt get back on. i check the server on the vps and it was fine, it was running. i had this problem once before but i was able to fix it by redownloading DUC. This time however, i redownloaded, made a new account on no-ip, reset my no-ip… everything possible (i think)
here is what the no-ip DUC keeps saying over and over…

My server has now been down 36 hours, because of this no-ip problem… If anyone can help i will greatly appreciate it and i will even reward you somehow on my server, or a paypal gift (:[/quote]

not a no-ip issue, its with vps.
This is your issue:
when leaving your vps on did you just close out of it?

When getting off your vps you must make sure you dissconnect properly as you would with a regular computer.
Logging in continuesly into your vps can cause connection problems because you would have 2 different active screens at the same time.

Read full topic
